eligibility.heading: Eligibility Criteria
eligibility.general: Candidate must have secured at least 60% marks of the aggregate marks in four compulsory subjects i.e. Chemistry, Physics, Biology/Math, and English taken together in a 10+2 pattern or equivalent examination from a recognized Board/University shall be eligible to join the first semester of the course or intermediate/10+2 with agriculture subjects.

programHighlights.heading: Program Highlights
programHighlights.intro: A top B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture college provides a strong foundation in Agricultural Science. With a 4-year program from the best B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture colleges, you learn modern farming practices.
highlights: The course structure is based on the curriculum recommended by the Fifth Deans' Committee of ICAR and adopted by SDSUV.

In our academic framework, following global standards in agriculture, the students are taught all fundamental agriculture subjects, including soil preparation, sowing, manuring, irrigation, weeding, harvesting, and storage.
Our extensive curriculum encourages the students in entrepreneurship and rural development.

With practical exposure to agricultural practices, the students get an edge with a strong focus on enhancing technical skills. In addition, with FDPs (Faculty Development Programs) and expert guest lecturers, we also help the faculty members stay updated with the latest advancements.

We facilitate students to gain field exposure, experimental learning, hands-on training, and the RAWE program, under the guidance of our competent faculty, international educational advisors, and visiting faculty.
The students are regularly encouraged by imparting training and developing their soft skills (like communication skills) to make them employable.

career.heading: Careers
career.description: Students can enter the workforce directly after completing B.Sc. (Hons) Agriculture, with opportunities available in both the government and private sectors. The top job roles for students after completion of their program include the following:
roles: Officer in Quality Assurance in Related Fields
Subject Matter Specialist in different Krishi Vigyan Kendras (KVKs)
Agri Field Officer in Nationalised Banks
Marketing Managers in the fertilizer, pesticide, and insecticide industries, and other agro industries

faqs.question: What are some top careers in Biology other than MBBS?
faqs.answer: Apart from MBBS, B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture is one of the best Biology-based careers, offering opportunities in agronomy, horticulture, agribusiness, research, and biotechnology.

faqs.question: Which job is best without NEET?
faqs.answer: B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture is a top choice without NEET, leading to careers such as Agricultural Officer, Agronomist, Farm Manager, and roles in government and private sectors.

faqs.question: List some top courses after 12th in PCB.
faqs.answer: Some top courses after 12th PCB include B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture, Biotechnology, Microbiology, Environmental Science, and Food Technology. Among these, B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture offers the widest career scope.

faqs.question: What is the scope of BSc in Agriculture?
faqs.answer: B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture has excellent scope in government jobs, agribusiness, research, higher studies, and entrepreneurship, making it a highly career-oriented degree.
